educations.title: High School
descriptions: At 16 yr/o, I settled down with my family in San Francisco and went to Balboa High School.
I spent little more than a year to complete my high school degree and successfully completed all credits without any fallout and got 3.8 GPA overall.

educations.title: Business
educations.school: City College of San Francisco & College of San Mateo
descriptions: Graduating from high school, I went to CCSF and CSM intending to pursue first two years education of a four-year degree in Marketing program.
more: However, there were too many students and classes were limit enrollment. My plan of transfer to SF State is delayed.
Overall, I successfully completed all credits without any fallout and got 3.4 GPA in both colleges.

educations.title: Bachelor - Business (Concentration in Marketing)
descriptions: The education was mainly business, but I also learned about technology in business statistics such as SPSS, SQL, and more.
more: During my time in college, I specialized in marketing.
Here I learned about the importance of technology, user experience, attention to detail, and problem solving.

educations.title: Associate - Computer Science Application and Development
descriptions: 3 years from my undergraduate completion, I designed to go back college as a full time student and pursue on an Associate Degree - Computer Science Applications and Development.
more: The education mainly focuses on cultivating students to become computer professionals who are technically competent in computer programming languages, able to use internet programming languages to design and implement a web based program, Work collaboratively and ethically in teams on projects, and more.
I learnt multiple computer languages from there, such as C++, Java, Python, Javascript and Unix. Until now, I successfully completed all the credits without any fallout and got A grade overall.

educations.title: Front-End Developer Nano Degree
descriptions: During the associate degree program in CSM, I found my interest in Website development.
Thus, I signed up the Front-End Web Developer Nanodegree program in Udacity to sharpen my skills specialized in web development.
more: This program starts from basic html, css, and JavaScript to popular framework such as AngularJS, EmberJS, and ReactJS.
I also learned to use modern web development tools and softwares such as GitHub, Grunt, and atom.
The course consists of total 8 projects which help me to pratice and demonstrate the skills that learned from the course.
This website is the result of learning AngularJS in this course. As of building this website, I am planning to complete this program in July 2018.
